item.name: Uptime
item.description: "The amount of time since this host was last initialized. Note that this is different from sysUpTime in the SNMPv2-MIB [RFC1907] because sysUpTime is the uptime of the network management portion of the system."

item.name: Device description
item.description: A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software. It is mandatory that this only contain printable ASCII characters.

item.name: Hostname
item.description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name.

item_prototype.name: $1 sensor value
item_prototype.description: The most recent measurement obtained by the agent for this sensor.

item_prototype.name: {#CPU} status
item_prototype.description: "The current operational state of the device described by this row of the table. A value unknown(1) indicates that the current state of the device is unknown. running(2) indicates that the device is up and running and that no unusual error conditions are known. The warning(3) state indicates that agent has been informed of an unusual error condition by the operational software (e.g., a disk device driver) but that the device is still 'operational'. An example would be a high number of soft errors on a disk. A value of testing(4), indicates that the device is not available for use because it is in the testing state. The state of down(5) is used only when the agent has been informed that the device is not available for any use."

item_prototype.name: {#CPU} load - percentage
item_prototype.description: "The average, over the last minute, of the percentage of time that this processor was not idle. Implementations may approximate this one minute smoothing period if necessary."

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMPv3 Palo alto OS 8.1:hrStorageUsed.["{#STOR}"].last()} / {Template SNMPv3 Palo alto OS 8.1:hrStorageSize.["{#STOR}"].last()} * 100 > 98
trigger_prototype.name: Free disk space is less than 2% on {#STOR}

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMPv3 Palo alto OS 8.1:hrStorageUsed.["{#STOR}"].last()} / {Template SNMPv3 Palo alto OS 8.1:hrStorageSize.["{#STOR}"].last()} * 100 > 95
trigger_prototype.name: Free disk space is less than 5% on {#STOR}

dependency.name: Free disk space is less than 2% on {#STOR}
dependency.expression: {Template SNMPv3 Palo alto OS 8.1:hrStorageUsed.["{#STOR}"].last()} / {Template SNMPv3 Palo alto OS 8.1:hrStorageSize.["{#STOR}"].last()} * 100 > 98

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMPv3 Palo alto OS 8.1:hrStorageUsed.["{#STOR}"].last()} / {Template SNMPv3 Palo alto OS 8.1:hrStorageSize.["{#STOR}"].last()} * 100 > 90
trigger_prototype.name: Free disk space is less than 10% on {#STOR}

dependency.name: Free disk space is less than 5% on {#STOR}
dependency.expression: {Template SNMPv3 Palo alto OS 8.1:hrStorageUsed.["{#STOR}"].last()} / {Template SNMPv3 Palo alto OS 8.1:hrStorageSize.["{#STOR}"].last()} * 100 > 95

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMPv3 Palo alto OS 8.1:ifAdminStatus.["{#IFNAME}"].last()}=1 and {Template SNMPv3 Palo alto OS 8.1:ifOperStatus.["{#IFNAME}"].last()}=2
trigger_prototype.name: {#IFNAME} interface down
trigger_prototype.description: interface ifAdminStatus is up(1) and ifOperStatus is down(2)

trigger.expression: {Template SNMPv3 Palo alto OS 8.1:snmptrap["HA link change"].str(link down,#1)}=1
trigger.recovery_expression: {Template SNMPv3 Palo alto OS 8.1:snmptrap["HA link change"].str(link up,#1)}=1
trigger.name: HA link status critical

trigger.expression: {Template SNMPv3 Palo alto OS 8.1:snmptrap["General trap"].str(System restart,#1)}=1
trigger.recovery_expression: {Template SNMPv3 Palo alto OS 8.1:snmptrap["General trap"].str(Dataplane is now up,#1)}=1
trigger.name: System restart
